definition: to thank sb for favor (esp. emperor or superior official)
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
surname Xie
favor/grace/kindness
variant of 恩[en1]

sentences.english: For if I by grace be a partaker, why am I evil spoken of for that for which I give thanks?
sentences.chinese: 我若谢恩而吃，为什么因我谢恩的物被人毁谤呢。

sentences.english: For if I by grace be a partaker, why am I evil spoken of for that for which I give thanks?
sentences.chinese: 我若谢恩而吃，为什么因我谢恩的物被人毁谤呢。

sentences.english: Tell you what, why don’t you write a special grace for tomorrow?
sentences.chinese: 跟你说吧，你干吗不为明天特别写一个谢恩祷告呢？

sentences.english: The tests showed people who didn't sleep at all had lower immunity, says Dr.Shane.
sentences.chinese: 结果显示不睡觉的人身体免疫力低下，谢恩博士说。

definition: to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to apologize humbly/to beg forgiveness
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
to kneel down
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to obey the Emperor's decree/at your Imperial majesty's command
issue a decree
to have an audience (with the emperor)
to salute/to make one's salutations
to kowtow/to kneel and worship
to kowtow in salute
to kneel three times and kowtow nine times (formal etiquette on meeting the emperor)
to bow in salute/to kowtow
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to pay respects/to wish good health/in Qing times, a specific form of salutation (see also 打千[da3 qian1])
